title: Victorybit1
author: Victorybit1
content: International Women's Day is a global day celebrating the social, economic,  political and cultural  achievements of women. It is a day to create awareness about the ongoing struggle of gender equality and the struggle or challenge we face as women in the society especially here in Africa.International Women's Day is celebrated on March 8th each year and is recognized by governments and individuals around the globe. It is also a day to honor the important role that women play in their families, communities, and  the societies.I am proud to be a woman, I'm strong, I'm a goal getter, I'm a mother, I'm unselfish. I've face a lot of chanllenges as a woman but came out unscathed.Happy international women's day to all the hardworking women here.

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: International days are occasions to educate the public on issues of concern, to mobilize political will and resources to address global problems, and to celebrate and promote human achievements. International Women's Day is one of those occasions to remind the world of the centuries-old struggle that women have been carrying out at all levels. Despite all the successes that have been achieved in the field of women's rights, there is still a long way to go to achieve true equality with men.Happy international women's day to all the hardworking women here.Greetings to African women in particular, since they suffer more than the rest of the world.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: It's not all about the marking of the international women's day celebration alone, but the world is endowed and blessed with women of virtues, mothers of honour, we are also celebrating their unique roles in every aspect of life, how could the world have be without women, they are the strength behind every successful man, they gave birth to us all passing through the curdles of nine months pregnancy and nurture the child to grow and now we became what we are through their passionate love in raising us up in the right way, we celebrate every woman in the world today.

comments.author: Minecache
comments.body: Quote from: Kavelj22 on March 08, 2023, 10:13:07 AMHappy international women's day to all the hardworking women here.Greetings to African women in particular, since they suffer more than the rest of the world.Why do women in Africa suffer more than the rest of the world? I think there are happy and miserable people everywhere, no place is more miserable than anywhere. To be fair, although the world has become fairer, I still see that there is something male has priority over female, the distinction has not entirely disappeared. Women are always more disadvantaged than men, both in the family as well as in society. But today is their day, give them the best. Happy World Women's Day, hope the world becomes more and more equal.

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: Quote from: Minecache on March 08, 2023, 12:38:03 PMWhy do women in Africa suffer more than the rest of the world? I think there are happy and miserable people everywhere, no place is more miserable than anywhere.There are cultural differences. In some places of the world, living conditions are more difficult. In some countries you are discriminated against because you are a woman, in others because you are gay or you don't believe in religions etc.. I see the world making progress (We have evolved from societies where people stone women to societies that pay less to women) on these issues, but there is still a long way to go. There are very few women who are interested in Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies. I would like their numbers to increase. In general, I congratulate all working women's day.

comments.author: Swordsoffreedom
comments.body: Quote from: EFS on March 08, 2023, 06:35:35 PMThere are very few women who are interested in Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies. I would like their numbers to increase. In general, I congratulate all working women's day.I have a couple of female friends who also like to invest in bitcoin, simply because she knows it generates money for us. But I think women have more work to do than men, so I think that's why they don't have time to engage in investing or other activities like men. In addition to outside work, women today also have to spend time doing housework at home as well as taking care of children. We call it an equal and fair world, but much of that work is still done by women, and that's also a loss for them. As men, we have time to drink with friends, but as women, they hardly have time to rest, let alone earn extra income.

In general, I congratulate all working women's day.The world has made a lot of progress in its quest for gender equality but we still have a long way to go. Religious belief has become one of the leading tools for subjecting women to slavery and suffering. We hear about child marriage going on in some parts of the world, where children are forced to marry men that are old enough to be their grandfathers. The issue of Afghanistan is a pathetic one where the Taliban have chased out the girl child from schools because of religion. Boko Haram terrorists in West Africa have always kidnapped female schoolchildren because they believe that girls are created to serve in the kitchen or become full housewives. Culturally women are seen as second-class citizens. The men can commit some offense and can be spared by society but if a woman commits that same crime, she will be disgraced and sometimes beaten to death. The world is blinded by religion and culture and it will take education and meditation to stop this attack on the female race.

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: Quote from: blockman on March 08, 2023, 09:59:35 PMQuote from: Kavelj22 on March 08, 2023, 10:13:07 AMGreetings to African women in particular, since they suffer more than the rest of the world.That's sad to know but there really are huge gaps between countries on how they treat women from place to place. Still, I'm sure that someday it'll change.We all live in the hope that this liberation will be achieved and an end to the suffering that has been going on for centuries. Unfortunately, there are not many encouraging signs because the causes of the crisis are complex and intertwined between economic, political and even biological. Women struggle to complete their rights in all parts of the world, and African women are the worst, so they are at the bottom of the ranking, even in the ladder of liberation. We see many examples of women in poor and conservative countries who succeeded in obtaining a significant status and regaining a large part of their rights, but this does not seem easy in African countries, especially sub-Saharan Africa.
